itemDescription: football player and manager in the first half of the 20th century (1883-1962)

wikipedia_page.main: Patrick Travers  (28 May 1883 – 5 February 1962) was a Scottish football player and manager in the first half of the 20th century. He played for many clubs in his native Scotland and for Barnsley in England, before becoming involved in coaching, and later, management, winning the Scottish Cup with Clyde on two occasions either side of World War II.
